You wake up, and are overcome with an immense thirst.
Next to your bed, you have a stale, flat soda that has been there longer than you care to think about.
You can either drink this suspect soda, or get out of bed and go to the kitchen to get some water.

Getting out of bed sounds hard, so you reluctantly reach for the formerly carbonated beverage. Unfortunately, in your sleep-addled state, you knock the sugary substance over. It lands all over your phone and your cat. Which do you attempt to dry?
You grab your furious feline and remove the rancid remains of the soda. Out of breath and covered in scratches, you head to the kitchen.
As you rinse your wounds and fill a glass, you remember that your phone is water-proof. Congratulations! You drank some water!
You frantically begin drying your phone as your cat tears out of the room, spraying the noxious beverage behind it.
Your kitty in his panic collapses your pile of dirty laundry onto the space heater in the next room. Your house crumbles in flames while you watch in awe, but at least you have your phone… right?

You drag yourself out of bed and stumble into the kitchen. You have only one cup in your house, a comically over-sized coffee mug. (You really need to get some other ones.) Unfortunately, that mug has been sitting in your sink for some time, and is looking rather fuzzy. You can either use the mug as-is, or make the effort to wash it first.
You decide not to take any risks, and, heck, you already made the effort to get out of bed. You pump some soap into the mug, and thoroughly wash the vessel inside and out.
You fill your newly clean mug with water, applauding yourself for not being lazy. Congratulations! You drank some water!
You lower your standards a little bit lower and think to yourself, \"What\'s the worst that could happen?\" You fill the mug with water and take a sip.

As you lie in the hospital a few days later, you realize that the worst that could happen is a severe case of food poisoning that has left you bed-ridden and miserable. You vow to yourself to mend your lazy ways … or at least buy a few new cups.
Abandon hope and drink the soda.
Go to the kitchen, I have standards.
